intro: Calyptranthes seemannii, commonly known as the Kauai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Calyptranthes seemannii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of the Hawaiian Islands and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
